me.normanmaurer.niosmtp.transport.impl
Class LimitingSMTPClientTransport

java.lang.Object
  me.normanmaurer.niosmtp.transport.impl.LimitingSMTPClientTransport
All Implemented Interfaces:
SMTPClientTransport
Direct Known Subclasses:
PooledSMTPClientTransport
public class LimitingSMTPClientTransport
extends Object
implements SMTPClientTransport

SMTPClientTransport implementation which allows to wrap another SMTPClientTransport and act as connection limiter. If the connect(InetSocketAddress, SMTPClientConfig, SMTPResponseCallback) method is called and the max configured connections are reached its just queued and dispatched once another connection was closed. If a the configured queue size is reached this implementation will call the {@link SMTPResponseCallback#onException(SMTPClientSession, Throwable) method to notify the callback about the problems

Author:
Norman Maurer

Constructor Detail

LimitingSMTPClientTransport

public LimitingSMTPClientTransport(SMTPClientTransport transport,
                                   int connectionLimit,
                                   int maxQueuedConnectionLimit)
Create a new LimitingSMTPClientTransport which wraps another SMTPClientTransport

Parameters:
transport - the SMTPClientTransport which should be limited
connectionLimit - the connectionLimit to use. This value must be >= 1
maxQueuedConnectionLimit - the maximal number of queued connection requests. If the limit is reached and a new request is made via the connect(InetSocketAddress, SMTPClientConfig, SMTPResponseCallback) method, this implementation takes care of calling the SMTPResponseCallback.onException(SMTPClientSession, Throwable) method. Use -1 to make the queue unlimited
Method Detail

getMaxQueuedConnectionLimit

public int getMaxQueuedConnectionLimit()
Return the maximal queued connection limit. After this is hit every new connect(InetSocketAddress, SMTPClientConfig, SMTPResponseCallback) attempt will trigger an SMTPResponseCallback.onException(SMTPClientSession, Throwable) call. For unlimited -1 is used

Returns:
maxQueuedLimit

public int getConnectionCount()
Return the current active connection count

Returns:
count

getConnectionLimit

public int getConnectionLimit()
Return the configured connection limit. If the limit is hit the request is queued for later execution (as soon as possible).

Returns:
connLimit
